alert.note: Alert for Placer; Sacramento; Solano; Sutter (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 7:20PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Placer. In northern California, Sacramento, Solano, Sutter and Yolo. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.4 inches of rain have fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area through 9 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sacramento, Elk Grove, Roseville, Citrus Heights, Davis, Woodland, Carmichael, Rancho Cordova, West Sacramento, Dixon, Arco Arena, Rio Linda, Freeport, Parkway-South Sacramento, Elverta, Verona, Karnak, Florin, Laguna West-Lakeside and North Highlands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
